awd_abstract_narration: This project supports the development of the laboratory                         components of manufacturing and robotics options in the General                 Engineering Department at San Jose State University. The                        project will develop a modern instrumentation and robotics                      laboratory to complement the lecture component of two courses                   in these options. In addition to the equipment, the project                     also includes the development of nine experiments for these two                 courses all of which are designed to demonstrate the principles                 of control theory as applied to robotics. All laboratories will                 be developed in partnership with industrial representatives                     from the local region ensuring that they are both educationally                 and industrially relevant.                                                      This project continues a five-year effort to convert the                        pedagogical approach used in all instruction in the College                     from a predominantly lecture mode to a fully integrated                         lecture-lab approach.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: SAN JOSE STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION
